boardgame.name: Torment and Legacy: A Pathfinder Second Edition Demo Adventure
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

The town of Salvoy needs your help! A fearsome Ogre kidnapped the town sage and only you can save him!

Torment and Legacy is a short introductory adventure for Pathfinder Second Edition! Perfect for a quick demo of the game for up to six players, you should be able to complete this story in as little as 1 hour. You will need the Pathfinder Core Rulebook and dice to play, although you might want to include Flip-Mat Classics: Hill Country and a handful of miniatures to represent the players and the monsters.

boardgame.name: PF2E Iconics Pregenerated Characters
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

This package contains pregenerated characters for use in the Pathfinder Society.

boardgame.name: You Against the City
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It does not matter if you love the City,...

you could just as well hate it, respect it or pity it. It will not return your feelings. It simply does not care about you. Not out of a conscious decision, but because it does not take notice of you, does not need to and will never do. The City goes on. It decays and rejuvenates, vulgarizes and shines, moans and sings, hibernates and sways, swells and falls apart. All to the rhythm of the people that push themselves through it while they follow the current they mutually generate for another.

“You against the City” is a collection of 36 potentially harmful incidents, written for and compatible with Dark Streets & Darker Secrets”(tm). It also contains suggestions for the Referee how to insert them into the game. It is furthermore an adaption of, and has been build upon, 30 Random Problems – Cyberpunk, an older release of mine.

boardgame.name: Slime Time
boardgame.description:
These dungeon slime are sick and tired of being treated as second-tier enemies defeated only for experience. Their plan? Combine to form the biggest slime boss! The player with the biggest slime boss wins! This take that card game for 2-5 players is fun for the whole family and comes with 54 cards (1 rule card).
The objective of the game is simple: have the most point values in your slime deck. Each turn, players can perform 3 total actions. The actions are: Place a slime in your slime deck, or play the effect of a card. If a card's effect is played, follow the effect and send it to the discard (if applicable). The game ends when the deck runs out of cards.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Meet Me At The Table Games

boardgame.name: Fozzy Football
boardgame.description:
A classic battle of skill, played shuffleboard style, that lets opponents engage in a game of American-rules football.

Players slide a shuffle puck toward run and pass targets. Look out for penalties, interceptions and fumbles!

It an action-filled, fast-paced game that gets the adrenaline pumping and competitive juices flowing.

The game requires a mobile app, free download from either the Apple or Google Play store. The app keeps track of down, yards remaining, line of scrimmage, timeouts, the play clock, game clock and score. It also includes an announcer that adds color commentary to the game based upon the outcome of each slide.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Does Love Forgive?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Does Love Forgive? This is a collection of one-to-one scenarios for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game. Usually, Call of Cthulhu is played with one Keeper and between two to six investigators. Sometimes, though, it can be hard to get a group of players together, so the scenarios in this collection have been specifically designed for just two people: one Keeper and one player-investigator.

Each of the scenarios can be played over the course of one session, although the Keeper may wish to expand the adventures (based on the investigator’s actions), or create their own follow on adventures. While the first scenario, Love You to Death, is tied to a historical Valentine’s Day event in Chicago, the other scenario, Mask of Desire, can be moved to a different location and, potentially, a different time period other than the one specified, and advice is provided for how to handle such moves.

boardgame.name: Es Tu Funeral
It's Your Funeral
Scavati Pure la Fossa
To Twój pogrzeb
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A MULTI-PLOT ADVENTURE FOR WARHAMMER FANTASY ROLEPLAY

At GenCon 2019, I gave a talk that I called ‘Whose Night is Rough Anyway?’ in which I described the process of creating multi-plot adventures like those in the newly-released Rough Nights & Hard Days. As the audience called out ideas, we created the germ of the adventure that you are now reading.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Scavati Pure la Fossa - Italian PDF Edition

boardgame.name: Climate Crisis
boardgame.description:
Can you help solve the Climate Crisis?

With just under 8 billion people on the planet we face a threat of our own making as climate change seeks to wreak havoc across the globe. This is a crisis like no other.

Climate Crisis, the game, is a collaborative board game where you and your friends (maybe even your enemies) can sit down together and try and save not only the planet but humankind.

General game play description:
Players must work collaboratively to save the world from climate change. There is a tricky balance between moving to renewable energy, recycling, population, staying alive and keeping enough energy to keep going.

The goal is to optimise world population, stay alive and achieve environmental sustainability!

The players work together as they search for scientific discoveries that will solve our climate crisis. This needs to be done all the while the population and pollution across the planet grows and the level of Greenhouse Gases rises. Take too long and the planet dies from too much pollution or the Greenhouse Gases get to the point of no return. As the greenhouse gases rise the impacts from climate change increase and become more common!

Balance the needs for energy production from fossil fuels and environmentally sustainable sources. Keep the population with enough Food and Water. Players are faced with numerous challenges – you need energy to function but fossil fuels create pollution and damage the environment. Moving to clean energy costs time and money, and is not as efficient. Feeding the population with Dairy products can be effective but comes at the cost of energy and pollution. All the while the climate crisis clock keeps ticking!

Each player has special skills that they can use to work together to save the planet. A highly collaborative game where players need to coordinate their actions and devise plans and strategies to solve the crisis.

Sustainable Qualities:
This game is all about educating people about the trade offs around sustainability. The complex interaction between population, energy production and consumption, food production, water use, economic advancement. It also shows the impact of pollution and waste and the dramatic effects of climate change … whilst still giving people hope that if we collaborate and work together we can build a solution to escape the mess that we have made!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Final Word
boardgame.description:
The Final Word is an expandable collection of cool, clever, and challenging games for all who love word play in a single deck of 120 cards. Games combine puzzle-solving, word creation skills, and quick thinking. There are games of solitaire and games for the whole family. As with a traditional card deck, The Final Word is a bevy of games in one take-it-anywhere deck.

Games ranging from easy to expert can be learned in two minutes without a laborious list of rules. There are a handful of key principles that apply to all games and a group of five groovy moves in combinations specific to each game iteration. Games vary in length and space needed to play from sitting side-by-side at the bar to covering the entire dining room table.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Warhammer Armies (Fifth Edition): The Empire
boardgame.description: Warhammer Armies: The Empire is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (5th Edition)

boardgame.name: Aden
boardgame.description:
The civil war in Yemen has been going on since 2015; fought between the government, a rebellious faction, and their respective allies. Each group claims to be the legitimate government of Yemen. The fighting uses everything from World War 2 leftovers to modern ballistic missiles, with Saudi Arabian troops and US drone strikes helping the government and Iranian arms aiding the rebels.

Aden is a 2-player (but very solitaire friendly) hypothetical campaign for control of this southern Yemen port city, a combined company- and platoon-level game where each battle takes place over the course of one or more days. Difficult terrain splits the east and west of the city, combatants often retreat to avoid taking losses before surging back, and making the most of your scattered leadership is the key to resupplying your people and sustaining an offensive. Units activate with a unique dice system, and combat is centered on an add-or-subtract dice method reminiscent of Greg's Armageddon War.

The game remembers that Aden is a functioning city, with key points that will be strategic objectives in scenarios or have special combat effects. Destroy an enemy in sight of the international hotel where the media are staying? Extra victory points. Enemy is holed up near a major mosque? You cannot call artillery on them.

Aden includes:
- an 11 x 17 inch map of the city.
- seventy, LARGE 1 inch counters for the government, rebels, allies and status markers,
- a 32-page rulebook with a six scenario campaign for control of the city, each player playing both sides to see who does it best.

boardgame.name: RisiKo! Digital
boardgame.description:
RisiKo! Digital is a series of video games that simulate the board game RisiKo!, the only official transposition of the Italian system of rules, published by Editrice Giochi.

RisiKo! Digital was launched on 7 December 2002 by Editrice Giochi and developed in collaboration with Fi-System. The first CD-ROM version was stand-alone, for single player or online multiplayer . In 2006 it was replaced by RisiKo! Digital 2, online multiplayer flash version , developed by Kalicanthus Entertainment and published on Kalicanthus.it and on TGM Online . In July 2012 this version was replaced by RisiKo! Digital 3, available in multiplatform, with a client for Windows and Mac, an app for iOS and Android or via browser on Facebook.

The board is very similar in appearance to that of the board game, but it is possible to activate alternative colors of the territories, for example according to the owner.

In the first version offline single player mode it is possible to face three computerized opponents, with different selectable artificial intelligence, in games with traditional objectives or with tournament rules.

In the online versions it is possible to play for free for a limited period of 15 days or to subscribe for 1, 3 or 12 months. The game modes are 4 + 1:


Digital: 4-player game, each with 30 minutes available. (lasting about an hour)
UltraDigital: 4-player game, each with 30 minutes available and final match [1] . (duration about 45 minutes)
Prestige: game of 3 to 6 players with a fixed number of rounds of your choice and final match. (duration from 60 to 90 minutes approximately)
Pr3stige: 3-player game with a fixed number of turns of your choice. (duration about 30 minutes)
Challenge: 4-player game, each with 30 minutes available. (lasting about an hour)
Prestigious: game, currently beta, with 4 players, with the number of rounds varying 30, 40, 50. Each player has 3 minutes to make each turn, at the end of the game, the computer takes its place and acts as if the player is disconnected.


The regulation applied is not that of RisiKo! classic but the one used for the National Championship (whoever scores the most points wins; the points are those of the territories in their secret objective) as published by the publisher in the latest version of RisiKo! Challenge.

The game portal also offers the possibility to participate in a tournament called "Challenge" valid for the selections of the RisiKo! National Championship. To participate in the "Challenge" Tournament, you must first know and approve the Regulations and then register.

Source: Wikipedia.

boardgame.name: Petrichor: Collector's Edition Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
The Collector's Edition of Petrichor is an upgrade kit that brings your Petrichor experience to the next level.

This includes:

Collector's Edition Box (Featuring a newly illustrated cover by iella and is finished off with a spot UV coating.
Custom Molded Floating Clouds
Complete and Unified Rulebook
Full Custom Storage Solution in Collaboration with GameTrayz
Individual trays for each player
Customized trays for tokens, cards, and tiles
Custom tray to hold the new floating clouds
Fits all content ever created, including sleeved cards!



Does the Collector's Edition come only in the format of an Upgrade pack?

Yes. There are various reasons for this. Firstly we respect the large community of petrichor players, supporters and backers, and we wish to give them an option to get all of the content of the game in a cost-effective manner. We do not want collectors and long time supporters to have to purchase an entirely new set with a lot of components they already own. Secondly, since we are creating a brand new artwork for the deluxe edition, and know that collectors prefer to have every single released item for the game, this makes it easy and cost-effective for them to own both the artwork on the original base box, as well as the new artwork. So in other words, if you already have the base game, just get the upgrade pack, if you don't have the game at all, get a copy of the base game and the upgrade pack.

- description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Petrichor: Honeybee – The Swarming Promo Card

boardgame.name: Black Wolves Saga ~Bloody Nightmare~
Burakku Uruvusu Sāga - Buraddī Naitomea -
ブラック ウルヴス サーガ -ブラッディーナイトメア-
boardgame.description: Weblin is a kingdom inhabited by both humans and demi-humans, creatures who have the power to shift between both human and animal forms. For many years, humans, cats, and wolves shared political power, but one day the wolves revolted, plunging the country into chaos. At around the same time, a terrible plague called Zodiva began to spread and the wolves were suspected to be the cause. This led to King Garibaldi calling for the extermination of all wolves... Our story begins 10 years later with Fiona Galland, the only daughter of the Earl Galland. Because of her weak immune system and fragility due to a congenital disease, she has spent most of her sheltered life basically locked away in a tower. What will happen to her when she is accused of being a witch and is forcibly taken from the only home she has ever known...?

boardgame.name: Black Wolves Saga ~Last Hope~
Burakku Uruvusu Sāga - Rasuto Hōpu -
ブラック ウルヴス サーガ -ラストホープ
boardgame.description: In this world, different races are living together. There are humans, cats and wolves as well as rats, lions, dogs and rabbits. Weblin is a small kingdom located in the corner of a powerful continent, separated by the rest of the world by a lush forest surrounding it. For centuries the different races have been living in peace. Humans and wolves allowed the cats to rule the beautiful kingdom.

boardgame.name: Meiji Tokyo Renka
Meiji Tokyo Renka: Full Moon
明治東亰恋伽 Full Moon
boardgame.description: included a route for Tosuke Iwasaki, an original character from Gekijōban Meiji Tokyo Renka: Yumihari no Serenade and Gekijōban Meiji Tokyo Renka: Hana Kagami no Fantasia.

boardgame.name: War
boardgame.description:
War, Grow's famous strategy game, now in digital territory!

With the digital version of War you will discover that playing is one of the most exciting things out there. Feel yourself in the role of a true general. Aim at your goal and carefully define your strategy. Attack at the right time, protect your borders and defend your territories. Dominate entire continents, invade and conquer opposing territories. But evaluate your movements well because, as in great wars, poorly planned attacks can cause great powers to fall while the right strategy can transform small armies into great empires!

Now you can gather friends and use your smartphone or tablet as a digital board, or play alone against the computer. Or even play online with your friends and others, wherever they are.

The app makes the game much faster and more dynamic, making the matches last much less than the board version.


Game Modes:

• Local Mode: In this mode, you can play up to 6 people on the same smartphone or tablet, as if it were a digital board. Or you can play alone against the computer.
For this mode it is not necessary to use the internet. Play FREE and unlimited!
• Online Mode: Have fun playing War Online from 3 to 6 people. Now, you can play anytime and with people from anywhere. The SmartMatching intelligence system finds the ideal opponent for you, making your matches much more dynamic and challenging. Attention: for this game mode you must be connected to a Wi-Fi network.

• Friends Room: Add and challenge your friends in online War matches. Play with up to 5 friends on any device.
Attention: for this game mode it is necessary to be connected to the internet (Wi-Fi or 3G).


Features:

• Two game modes: Local and Online.
• Online multiplayer in real time.
• 1 player game option against the computer.
• Global Ranking.
• Play with your friends.
• Choose your GrowGames avatar.


Source: Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Biyi
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the traditional Chinese legend of Biyi (a one-winged bird), Biyi the game is an abstract strategy game for two players that combines the strategy of chess with the simplicity of checkers. It is unique in many ways, one of which being the fact that none of the playing pieces on the board are ever removed. Additionally, you must not only strategize in 2D, but also in 3D as you stack pieces atop one another in order to bypass your opponent's defenses or stop their advance.
The goal in Biyi is simple: be the first to get one of your playing pieces into your opponent's nest. However, accomplishing said goal will require cunning and strategic thinking, as players may, on their turn, move either a single playing piece or a stack of them. When moving, these pieces can climb onto other pieces, slide across pieces, jump from piece to piece, or descend from atop a stack. To make achieving victory even more of a challenge, a river stands between you and your opponent's nest, and crossing it will require clever positioning of not only your own pieces, but also the opponent's.

Do you have what it takes to slide, climb and fly your way to victory?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Saloon Showdown
boardgame.description:
Saloon Showdown is an unsettled boardgame where up to 7 gunslingers of all ages will try to collect the bounties on the heads of others, challenging each others in epic duels, truels and Mexican standoff!

Reflexes and speed of thought will determine the most skillful gunslinger... but there are also other, more devious ways to win!

...Do you feel lucky?

Starting from the player on the left of the dealer, the game proceeds clockwise in turns. In their turn each player can choose 1 of this actions: draw a card, cash the loot (discard some type of cards to earn dollars) or threaten somebody.

Threatening someone with a gun starts a brief "bluff or not" phase, which can lead to the heart of the game: the Duel.

In the Duel, two players must exchange their cards and be the quicker to shoot the other correctly, by guessing 3 things:

the color of the gun to take;
the zone of the body to hit;
the sound of the gunshot.


The correct information is the one that is most present on the cards in front of the player.

In the game there are also two variants of the Duel, which involve 3 players (Truel) or up to 5 (Mexican Standoff).

By playing cards and winning Duels, you earn (or steal) money.
The game ends when a player has $130 on his Loot zone, or when he has 3 Wound tokens (which you get by losing Duels).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Aces in Space
boardgame.description:
Publisher description (German)

Aces in Space – Ein Fate-Rollenspiel über eine Gang von Raumjägerpiloten halb Battlestar Galactica, halb Sons of Anarchy, ganz Social-Media-Star!

Ein gesetzloser Teil des Weltraums, der der Kobenigürtel genannt wird, gehört den Abweichlern: Pilot:innen, die sich zusammenrotten wie die Motorradclubs lange vergangener Zeiten. Tattoos und Kutten wurden von Cyberware und Druckanzügen abgelöst. Die Raumjäger werden liebevoll Chopper genannt, Jockeys nennen sich ihre Pilotinnen, und auf Highways fliegt man Lichtgeschwindigkeit: Mit Hilfe der Droge Minkowskium ist es möglich, Wurmlöcher zu passieren, um die weiten Distanzen des Alls zu durchkreuzen.

Doch anders als in der Vergangenheit scheuen die Kleinkriminellen das Rampenlicht nicht. Jedes waghalsige Manöver, jeder Kurvenkampf und jeder Coup werden live im Datanet übertragen und entscheiden über die Social-Media-Stars der Zukunft. Der dadurch entstandene Fankult sorgt dafür, dass einige Konzerne bei den Machenschaften der Staffeln nicht nur häufig ein Auge zudrücken, sondern sie sogar mit Sponsorengeldern unterstützen.

In diesem Fate-Setting spielt ihr Jockeys, verwegene Fliegerasse, die in eine dieser Gangs gehören. Ihr werdet Bandits in waghalsigem Kurvenkampf fertigmachen, ehrgeizige Coups durchführen und live auf euren Social Media davon erzählen. Erlebt Abenteuer im Spannungsfeld von toxischem Einzelgängertum und Teamgeist.

Dare to fly!

From the kickstarter campaign page (English)

In this roleplaying game, you play a Chopper Jockey, a dashing space pilot belonging to a gang. You'll fight bandits and bogeys in daring dogfights, pull off heists against overpowering mega-corps, and talk about it all live on your social media feed. Experience the thrill of stories right in the middle between toxic egoticity and teamwork.

In a lawless section of space, called the Kobeni-belt, aberrant pilots roam among the stars. Akin to motorcycle gangs from the past, tattoos and leather jackets are now replaced by cyberware and pressure suits. Space fighters are lovingly called Choppers, Jockeys are their pilots, and Highways now go faster than light: with the help of a drug called Minkowskium everyone can traverse wormholes to cross the vast distances of space.

Yet, unlike the past, today's petty criminals do not shy the limelight. Every daring maneuver, dogfight, and coup is broadcasted live on the datanet, making and breaking the social media celebrities of the future. Good social media publicity isn't something the mega-corps are opposed to, and sometimes, they even endorse it by sponsoring.

This game deals with behavior typically identified as toxic masculinity such as dominance posturing and self-injury. However, the game takes place in a setting that is past racism and heteronormativity.

Dare to fly!

boardgame.name: Fate vs The Devil
boardgame.description:
Fate vs The Devil is a solitaire card game that features set collection as the key task during play. This coincides with careful hand management and deck building on your part.

During this game you represent Fate, who is in a race against the Devil to collect the most souls from the medieval place known as the realm. Collecting cards to place in your crypt will earn you those souls. At the end of the game, soul points are calculated to determine the winner.

The Devil is a game-controlled opponent that only maintains a crypt and discard pile; whereas, you maintain the equivalent, along with hand cards and a player deck.

Aside from providing you with soul points, realm cards can serve you in other ways, such as acting as currency to purchase more cards, or as a way to perform special actions. Card purchases are made from the realm or from the Devil, with the latter requiring a higher premium.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Credence Barebone
boardgame.description:
Raised by a No-Maj anti-witchcraft group, the orphan Credence Barebone repressed his magical abilities, allowing a parasitic Obscurus to grow within him. Somehow resisting the creature, Credence became an Obscurial of immense power, making him of immeasurable value in the schemes of Grindelwald.

This set contains a finely detailed Credence Barebone miniature, which may be included in any Grindelwald’s Army or Magical Creatures group.

Contents:

1 60mm plastic base
1 Character card
4 Artefact cards
1 Assembly instructions

boardgame.name: Swords of the Serpentine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:
Swords of the Serpentine is a tabletop roleplaying game (RPG). It supports 1-7 players (with a sweet spot of 4-5) playing fantasy heroes inspired by sword & sorcery fiction, and one Game Master (GM) who keeps the adventure moving and plays the foes and supporting cast, also known as Supporting Characters.
This is a game of investigation, heroism, sly politics, and bloody savagery, set in a fantasy city rife with skulduggery and death. These rules adapt Pelgrane Press’ GUMSHOE system into a fantasy game with a relatively loose class structure and high-action roleplaying. These rules work fine even without the included setting of Eversink, and shine more brightly when political allegiances are closely tied to the heroes.

About the System
In Swords of the Serpentine, following sword & sorcery-style clues while roleplaying your character propels you headlong into mysteries and adventures filled with danger and forbidden knowledge. A clue may let you find lost and sunken treasure, ancient jungle ruins, the lost key to a sorcerous trap, or the identity of a charming murderer.

About the Setting
Eversink
Almost a thousand years ago, the “city” of Denaria was nothing more than several dozen squalid huts perched on a few islands in the swampy, salty river delta of the River Serpentine. The city’s patron goddess Denari soon pushed back the swamp and raised dozens more islands from the river’s bottom. Times have changed: close to 100,000 people dwell here now and the population soars during festivals or major market days. Long since renamed Eversink, the city looks westward onto a rich and well-protected sea harbor and boasts a powerful patron goddess who promotes trade and profit. Eversink is one of the best-known cities on the continent and wields unmatched economic power.

boardgame.name: Surge
Surge Deluxe
boardgame.description:
Surge®Deluxe is the supercharged block-matching puzzle game that electrifies your fingertips with lightning fast gameplay, unique mechanics & strategic depth!

Originally released on PlayStation Mobile, Surge was well received by press and gamers, who took to the leader boards (and NeoGAF) to show off their skills.

Surge®Deluxe is FuturLab’s response to feedback received from top players on those leader boards (and from the NeoGAF community). They demonstrated a deep understanding and appreciation for Surge that was way beyond anything we could have anticipated!

The simple block-chaining and screen clearing mechanics gradually reveal their tactical depth as special blocks get added to the mix. Advanced players will not just vent pressure to stay in the game, they’ll utilise the vents at critical times to multiply their scores and create massive clearance combos.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Break In: Area 51
boardgame.description:
To escape, you must first...break in!

Each title in the Break In game line presents a collaborative experience that begins the moment you lift the lid off the game box. Inside, you will see a 3D shape with graphics representing the area you are trying to break into. Your paperwork tells you to STOP and make sure you are all ready before you begin — get your cards laid out, settle in with all the players, read your instructions, then begin looking for clues to solve puzzles!

Soon, you will be told to open the game board and unfold the first of three layers, expanding your board and revealing the next layer you have to explore to uncover clues that will lead you further inside! It's a one-of-a-kind unboxing experience! Along the way, you'll see wonderful things, meet interesting characters, and complete amazing challenges using clever hints and a unique solution system. The final puzzle leads you to your goal — and then you must escape!

In Break In: Area 51, you are an alien trying to rescue your ship that was stolen by humans and is being dismantled deep inside the facility.

Die Quacksalber von Quedlinburg! - Die Alchemisten - 2. Erweiterung Die Alchemisten von Quedlinburg sind inzwischen weit über die Grenzen der Stadt hinaus bekannt. Ihre Heilkünste sind ebenso berühmt wie berüchtigt. Hilfesuchende kommen von weit her um ihre - teilweise überaus exotischen - Beschwerden „fachkundig" behandeln zu lassen. Hühneraugen, Hexenbuckel und Vampirismus (nicht selten als Polymorphe Lichtdermatose fehldiagnostiziert) sind nur einige der auftretenden Krankheiten. Hier werden die besten ihrer Zunft benötigt: Die Alchemisten von Quedlinburg nehmen sich der Härtefälle im Quacksalber-Geschäft an. Mit hochtechnisierten Apparaturen destillieren sie Essenzen um die Leiden ihrer Patienten zu lindern. Durch das Destillieren erhalten die Spieler wertvolle Boni und Sonderfunktionen, die zusätzliche Vorteile im weiteren Spielverlauf verschaffen. Dazu enthält die Erweiterung 20 neue Wahrsagekarten und zwei neue Zutaten-Bücher für das Narrenkraut.
